intro: Aquilegia magnolii, commonly known as the Magnolia bleeding heart, is a striking perennial plant native to the forests of eastern China. It features delicate, heart-shaped petals that bloom in shades of pink and white, creating a visually captivating display. The plant has compound leaves with a serrated edge, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its unique appearance and early spring blooming make it a valuable addition to botanical collections.
